Summary Hunter Whitney is a consultant, author, and instructor who brings a distinct UX design perspective to data visualization. He has advised corporations, start-ups, government agencies, and NGOs to achieve their goals through a thoughtful, strategic design approach to digital products and services.  
 
Hunter is the author of "Data Insights: New Ways to Visualize and Make Sense of Data”. He was also asked to contribute a chapter in the book, “Designing for Emerging Technologies: UX for Genomics, Robotics, and the Internet of Things”. Additionally, Hunter has written numerous articles covering a range of subjects for various online and print publications including UX Magazine. Summary As an Enterprise Architect, I'll help you wade through the technology choices & provide guidance to determine the right solutions for your environment. We'll apply real-world experiences across many verticals to formulate the right combination of services & product to maximize your existing investment in IT. As your Trusted Advisor, we'll evaluate the budget constraints of your fast-tracked project, and provide a cost-effective solution with timely advice to keep your focus where it needs to be--on your business and your customers. 
 
Specialties include Collaboration & Unified Communications, Cloud Migration, Storage & Data Management, Wireless Networking, Compute Resources, Complex Routing & Switching, Information Security, and BYOD environments.

Summary I have a thing for brands - I am fascinated with the diverse brands in our culture and the storytelling that brings them to life - as well as the audiences that adore them. I love weaving visual and written content around the people and passions behind a brand, creating compelling stories that grow fans, awareness and sales. My work spans the breadth of digital marketing - branding, creative, social media, websites, content, videos and online strategy.  
 
I have shaped Social Media and Content Strategy for some of the best-known brands around the globe, as well as many growing companies and startups. I have a proven track record developing social media programs that successfully power online conversations and ignite share-ability with awesome content. I am also known for creating innovative promotion strategies across platforms to drive awareness, growth, and revenue. I support my clients in evolving their communities and optimizing social effort with processes and customized analytics and measurement strategies. 
 
Personal Branding consulting is one of my most popular services. It is built around helping you create and manage a memorable personal brand for your career and business partnerships - both online and offline. I combine best practices of sales, psychology, social media, marketing, and branding to connect the dots so you can successfully and efficiently manage your career and position yourself as a thought leader and the "go-to" person in your chosen area of expertise and focus. Finally, I will help you build community and create awareness around your work using content strategy and social media best practices. See my presentation below to get a feel for what I do! 
 
I am regularly asked to speak at national and local events on a variety of subjects at the intersection of branding, social media, PR, and content strategy. Summary Consumption models are changing to cloud and subscription-based services, and businesses today are transforming to anticipate new customer transactions and relationships. As the Metrics Lead for the newly formed Cisco Sales Global Customer Success Team, Bob defined the core metrics for these new transactions, discovering at the dawn of this evolution in Cisco’s journey, which metrics capture most meaningfully the customer’s success and Cisco’s efforts to promote it through realizing the value of their Cisco technology 
 
Previously as a Cisco Consultant Bob made substantial development contributions in several business areas, including Services, where Bob created the online executive dashboard for Cisco's Services leader and senior executives; CMO; General Business Services; US Sales Marketing; and Marketing IT, where Bob managed Marketing IT’s stakeholder communications for Customer Intelligence Center, re-architecting Cisco’s marketing databases across the full span of Cisco’s marketing technology. As a Program Manager Bob managed partner online learning analytics and advocated for business intelligence (BI) best practices across Cisco with Tableau, focusing in Channel Sales and Finance on the Partner’s cross-functional experience 
 
At Genentech Bob created a biotechnology and pharmaceutical managed care BI dashboard for the re-engineered Payer Account Manager role, with insights and quantitative information used internally for performance evaluation and externally for funding justification 
 
Bob created the marketing analytics function at Siemens EN and led thought in this space, introduced targeted marketing and a comprehensive enterprise process for measuring marketing effectiveness with ROI, created the installed base single source of truth, and completed a C-level customer segmentation model that resulted in strategic change in the enterprise’s sales and channel mix strategy with buy-in from all executive stakeholders

Going forward the solution was processed monthly by a small resource.
